Register to vote before Mon., Nov. 27 for the special election by checking your status, updating your information, and finding your polling place.

Dear ##first_name[ACLU Supporter]##,

One of the most important lessons we should take away from the 2016 election last year is that every vote matters. Every vote in every election is an opportunity to make a difference for ourselves and our communities.

Tuesday, December 12 is Alabama's next chance to vote. This statewide election is to select the U.S. Senator that will fill the seat vacated by Jeff Sessions when he became Attorney General.

Register to vote online before the Monday, November 27 deadline.

At the Secretary of State's website, you can also check your registration status, update your voting information, find your polling place, and download an application for an absentee ballot.

This election is open to all registered Alabama voters, no matter who you voted for in the primary or any other previous election.

Visit our website to learn more about your voting rights before and on election day.

Your vote is your voice. Use it.

ACLU of Alabama
